translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, having conjured up their own bodies like the body of the Tathāgata, purify the abode in Tuṣita, and are born in the abode of the class of Brahmā gods, up to the Akaniṣṭha gods,🔽and with skillful means teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa rnams la yang chos ston pa dag yod do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa rnams la yang chos ston pa dag yod do //
translated: and also teach the Dharma to the beings in the animal world and the world of Yama.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing bdag nyid kyi lus sangs rgyas kyi sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing bdag nyid kyi lus sangs rgyas kyi sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul nas /
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who stand in the six perfections and, having magically created a body like the body of a buddha,

original: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing @72b sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing @72b sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
translated: go to as many buddhafields in the eastern direction as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, teach the Dharma to beings, serve the tathāgatas, listen to the Dharma, and see the bodhisattva saṅgha and the special qualities of the buddhafields,

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
translated: and having taken up the signs of those buddhafields,

original: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
analyzed: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
translated: establish many buddhafields that are even vaster and more special than those,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang /
translated: They cause the bodhisattva great beings who are only one birth away from awakening to be born in those buddha realms.

original: nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur bar byed pa dang /
translated: In the same way, they go to as many buddha realms as there are sand grains in the Ganges River in each of the directions—south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above—and teach the Dharma to sentient beings, serve the thus-gone ones,

original: chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
translated: listen to the Dharma, see the saṅgha of bodhisattvas, and behold the displays of the qualities of the buddha realms. They take note of the characteristics of those buddha realms.

original: de bas kyang rgya che ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
analyzed: de bas kyang rgya che ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
translated: They will also create many buddhafields that are even more vast and exalted than those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed cing /
translated: In those buddhafields they will cause bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are only one birth away from awakening to be born.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang yod do zhes bya ba ni gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang yod do zhes bya ba ni gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba'o //
translated: They will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in various buddhafields.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bsam gtan dang / gzugs med par sgrub par byed pa dag tshangs ris nas dge rgyas kyi bar gyi lha rnams su skye zhing /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bsam gtan dang / gzugs med par sgrub par byed pa dag tshangs ris nas dge rgyas kyi bar gyi lha rnams su skye zhing /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the dhyānas and formless states and are born among the gods from the Brahmakāyika to the Bṛhatphala.

original: de nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye bar byed de /
translated: From there they are born in the Ākāśānantyāyatana up to the Bhavāgra.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang / gzugs @73a * //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'o // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang / gzugs @73a * //
translated: This is the one who goes to the peak of existence.

original: med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mchid nas srid pa'i rtsa mo'i bar du skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mchid nas srid pa'i rtsa mo'i bar du skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who attain the concentrations and formless absorptions. They are reborn in the Ākāśānantyāyatana and so on up to the Bhavāgra.🔽Then they are reborn in various buddha-fields.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su skye bar 'gyur ba dag yod do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su skye bar 'gyur ba dag yod do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: This is the one who is free from attachment to the form realm.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, when they practice the six perfections,

original: lus la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan cing dbang po yongs su dag pa bla na med pa rnams dang ldan te /🔽nam yang ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / bdag nyid la stong par mi byed /
analyzed: lus la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan cing dbang po yongs su dag pa bla na med pa rnams dang ldan te / nam yang ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / bdag nyid la stong par mi byed /
translated: Their bodies are adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and they have the highest pure faculties.

original: gzhan la smod par mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan la smod par mi byed de /
translated: They never take rebirth in the lower realms of unfortunate destinies, and they do not disparage themselves or others.

original: de dag dbang po yongs su dag pa de rnams dang ldan pas skye bo mang po byams shing yid du 'ong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dbang po yongs su dag pa de rnams dang ldan pas skye bo mang po byams shing yid du 'ong par 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with these pure faculties, they are loved and liked by many people.

original: sems can gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag mthong ba de dag kyang sems rab tu dang ba de nyid kyis theg pa gsum gyis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag mthong ba de dag kyang sems rab tu dang ba de nyid kyis theg pa gsum gyis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: Those sentient beings who see those bodhisattva great beings become filled with faith. By that very faith, they gradually attain complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings should train in that way in the purification of the body,

original: dag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: in the purification of the speech, and in the purification of the mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gang dag dbang po shin tu gsal pa thob nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gang dag dbang po shin tu gsal pa thob nas /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections who, having attained very clear faculties,

original: de dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba de dag gis bdag la mi stong cing gzhan la mi smod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba de dag gis bdag la mi stong cing gzhan la mi smod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: with those very clear faculties do not praise themselves and do not disparage others.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, starting from the production of the first thought,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su mi skye ba dag yod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su mi skye ba dag yod do //
translated: They abide in the perfection of generosity and the perfection of moral discipline, and until they attain the irreversible level, they are never reborn in the lower realms, in the unfortunate destinies.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, from the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi @73b gtong ba dag yod do //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi @73b gtong ba dag yod do //
translated: until they attain the irreversible level, never abandon the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the perfection of generosity and the perfection of moral discipline, become universal monarchs,

original: sems can rnams la sbyin pa byin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la sbyin pa byin te /
translated: and give gifts to sentient beings.

original: de dag nyid dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la rab tu dgod pa dag yod do //
analyzed: de dag nyid dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la rab tu dgod pa dag yod do //
translated: They establish them in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya phrag du ma yongs su bzung /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya phrag du ma yongs su bzung /
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings, while standing in the perfection of generosity and the perfection of moral discipline, take up many hundreds of universal monarchies,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong phrag du ma yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong phrag du ma yongs su bzung ste /
translated: take up many hundreds of thousands of universal monarchies,

original: de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byed de /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad la bkur stir byed /
analyzed: de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byed de / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad la bkur stir byed /
translated: and while standing in those they please many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhas,🔽and they respect, revere, honor, and worship all those lord buddhas,🔽and they stand in the perfection of patience and the perfection of perseverance,🔽and they stand in the perfection of concentration and the perfection of wisdom,

original: bla mar byed /🔽rim gror byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed / rim gror byed /
translated: and they stand in the emptiness meditative stabilization,🔽the signless meditative stabilization,🔽the wishless meditative stabilization,🔽the perfection of giving,🔽the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,

original: mchod par byed cing /
analyzed: mchod par byed cing /
translated: the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom,🔽and they stand in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽and they stand in the ten powers of a tathāgata,🔽the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and they stand in the knowledge of path aspects,🔽and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects,🔽and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects,🔽and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects, and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects, and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects, and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects, and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects, and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of path aspects, and they stand in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects,

original: de'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes bya ba ni mthong pa'i chos la mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag bsam gtan bzhi thob pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi thob pa de dag bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes bya ba ni mthong pa'i chos la mya ngan las 'da' ba'o // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag bsam gtan bzhi thob pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi thob pa de dag bsam gtan dang /
translated: Then, after that, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gis rnam par rtse zhing bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gis rnam par rtse zhing bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: “Śāriputra, those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who have attained the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions, those bodhisattva great beings, having attained those concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions, play with those concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions, and enter into the first concentration.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, they enter into the absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, they enter into the second concentration.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de las langs nas bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the third meditative concentration.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de las langs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the fourth meditative concentration.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de las langs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par @74a * //
analyzed: de las langs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par @74a * //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the sphere of infinite space.

original: 'jug go // de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'jug go // de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de las langs nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de las langs nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having risen from that, he enters meditative attainment in the sphere of nothingness.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the meditative absorption of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dag yod do //
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dag yod do //
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnams bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag yang dang yang du rnam par mnan cing snyoms par 'jug pas thod rgal la yang snyoms par 'jug pa nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnams bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag yang dang yang du rnam par mnan cing snyoms par 'jug pas thod rgal la yang snyoms par 'jug pa nas /
translated: Śāriputra, in that way, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom, endowed with skillful means, repeatedly enter into and arise from these meditative stabilizations, immeasurable states, meditative concentrations, and meditative absorptions, and they enter into alternating meditative equipoise, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba byed cing bdag nyid kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa'o // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba byed cing bdag nyid kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu
translated: They will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in various buddha-fields.” This is the direct experience of the body.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba de dang bral bar mi byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba de dang bral bar mi byed pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Śāriputra, there are also bodhisattva great beings who, having stood in the six perfections, illuminate the buddha-dharmas for beings and, until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, do not stop that illumination of the buddha-dharmas. ” This is the approach to the result of an arhat.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sangs rgyas mi bzhugs shing nyan thos rnams kyang med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rang byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sangs rgyas mi bzhugs shing nyan thos rnams kyang med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rang byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do //
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas who attain the awakening of a pratyekabuddha in worlds where there are no buddhas and no śrāvakas.

original: de dag thabs la mkhas pas srog chags brgya stong bye ba phrag mang po theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas
analyzed: de dag thabs la mkhas pas srog chags brgya stong bye ba phrag mang po theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas
translated: Through their skill in means they bring many hundreds of thousands of beings to maturity in the three vehicles and attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening.”

original: so // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag dran pa nye bar @74b gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag thob pa dang /
analyzed: so // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag dran pa nye bar @74b gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag thob pa dang /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas who attain the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams thob pa dag rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams thob pa dag rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed /
translated: They do not cause those who have attained the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha to attain the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par mi byed kyi /
translated: the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, or a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can thams cad lam la btsud cing rnam par sbyangs nas /
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can thams cad lam la btsud cing rnam par sbyangs nas /
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom and, with skillful means, cause all beings to enter the path and purify it.

original: sems can de dag des rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur bar byed pa dag yod de /
analyzed: sems can de dag des rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur bar byed pa dag yod de /
translated: They cause those beings to attain the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.🔽“

original: bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa gzhan de la rab tu dgod par byed do zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu rnams yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa gzhan de la rab tu dgod par byed do zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu rnams yin no //
translated: “I will establish others in that which I have not actualized myself” refers to the fruits to be attained by the paths of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i ye shes dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gis ma thob pa'i chos la gzhan 'god pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i ye shes dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gis ma thob pa'i chos la gzhan 'god pa yin no //
translated: “Śāriputra, the wisdom and abandonment that are the fruits to be attained by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are the acceptance of the bodhisattva great beings who have attained the acceptance of phenomena that do not arise.” This is the establishment of others in the Dharma that one has not attained oneself.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bus de ltar rnam par spyod pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bus de ltar rnam par spyod pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “Śāriputra, you should know that those bodhisattva great beings who practice like that with this perfection of wisdom are irreversible.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing dga' ldan gyi gnas yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing dga' ldan gyi gnas yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections, are purifying the abode of Tuṣita.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni skal ba bzang po par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni skal ba bzang po par shes par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, those bodhisattva great beings should be known as having good fortune.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa 'di gang la yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa 'di gang la yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, this is the clear realization of the buddhadharmas, which should be known as the irreversible bodhisattva great being.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de @75a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de @75a * //
translated: Śāriputra,

original: lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: therefore, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams kyi go skabs mi dbye'o zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams kyi go skabs mi dbye'o zhes bya ba 'di dag gis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gsal bar bstan to //
translated: These passages clarify the Sangha of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog la gdams pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction on the Jewel of the Sangha.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ physical action that is reprehensible, what is their verbal action that is reprehensible, and what is their mental action that is reprehensible?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord said to the venerable Śāriputra:🔽“Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, they do not give an opportunity for the physical, verbal, and mental actions that are reprehensible.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du gang gi lus kyi las yang dag par rtsom pa'i lus de ni gang yin /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du gang gi lus kyi las yang dag par rtsom pa'i lus de ni gang yin /
translated: Śāriputra, here a bodhisattva great being thinks like this: “What is that body whose bodily action is correctly undertaken?

original: gang gi ngag gi las yang dag par rtsom pa'i ngag de ni gang yin /
analyzed: gang gi ngag gi las yang dag par rtsom pa'i ngag de ni gang yin /
translated: What is that speech whose verbal action is correctly undertaken?

original: gang gi yid kyi las yang dag par rtsom pa'i yid de ni gang yin snyam pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang gi yid kyi las yang dag par rtsom pa'i yid de ni gang yin snyam pa 'di ni /
translated: What is that mind whose mental action is correctly undertaken?”

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Śāriputra, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ bodily, verbal, and mental action that is undertaken with evil.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni lus gang dang / ngag gang dang / yid gang gis ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / gnod sems dang / le lo dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni lus gang dang / ngag gang dang / yid gang gis ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / gnod sems dang / le lo dang /
translated: Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not see any body, speech, or mind with which they would practice stinginess, faulty morality, malice, laziness,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba'i sems skyed par byed pa'i lus mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba'i sems skyed par byed pa'i lus mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend a body that would generate distraction or a disturbed mind.

original: ngag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ngag mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend speech.

original: yid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yid mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend thought.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len bskyed pa gang yin pa 'di ni gnas med cing go skabs med do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len bskyed pa gang yin pa 'di ni gnas med cing go skabs med do //
translated: it is impossible and there is no chance that they would generate the negative reflex actions of body, speech, or mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra, it is because when bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections

original: lus kyi gnas @75b ngan len sbyong bar byed /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas @75b ngan len sbyong bar byed /
translated: they purify the negative reflex actions of the body,

original: ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed /
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed /
translated: they purify the negative reflex actions of speech,

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed do //
translated: and they purify the negative reflex actions of thought.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,🔽“Excellent, excellent, Venerable Subhūti!

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
translated: Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings purify the negative tendencies of the body, purify the negative tendencies of speech, and purify the negative tendencies of mind?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag mi dmigs pa dang / sems mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag mi dmigs pa dang / sems mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend the body, do not apprehend speech, and do not apprehend the mind,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: then bodhisattva great beings purify the negative tendencies of the body, speech, and mind.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, if bodhisattva great beings, from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te gnas shing /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te gnas shing /
translated: take up and follow the path of the ten virtuous actions,

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: and do not have the attitude of śrāvakas or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed pa med par de rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar 'jog pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed pa med par de rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar 'jog pa de ltar na /
translated: Without generating the mind of a pratyekabuddha, he constantly and always focuses his mind on great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: Śāriputra, I explain that this is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the negative propensities of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: “Śāriputra, those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who are training in the path to awakening practice the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: practice the perfection of conduct,🔽practice the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: practice the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed pa dag yod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed pa dag yod do //
translated: They are the bodhisattvas, the great beings, who practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nam lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag mi dmigs pa dang / @76a * //
analyzed: nam lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag mi dmigs pa dang / @76a * //
translated: they do not apprehend a body, they do not apprehend speech,

original: yid mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: yid mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: they do not apprehend a mind, they do not apprehend the perfection of generosity, they do not apprehend the perfection of conduct, they do not apprehend the perfection of patience, they do not apprehend the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / nyan thos mi dmigs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa dang /🔽sangs rgyas mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / nyan thos mi dmigs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
translated: and the buddhas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin te /
translated: “Śāriputra, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the nonapprehension of all phenomena.🔽“Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings travel this path and practice the six perfections, they are invincible.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam 'dis 'gro zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams la spyod pa ni thub par mi nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma zhen pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam 'dis 'gro zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams la spyod pa ni thub par mi nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma zhen pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction on nonattachment.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams gzhan thams cad kyis thub pa ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams gzhan thams cad kyis thub pa ma mchis pa lags /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings practice so that they are invincible to everyone?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽gzugs su mi rlom pa dang / tshor bar mi rlom pa dang / 'du shes su mi rlom pa dang / 'du byed rnams su mi rlom pa dang / rnam par shes par mi rlom pa dang / sa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / chu'i khams su mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe / gzugs su mi rlom pa dang / tshor bar mi rlom pa dang / 'du shes su mi rlom pa dang / 'du byed rnams su mi rlom pa dang / rnam par shes par mi rlom pa dang / sa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / chu'i khams su mi rlom pa dang /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not inflate form, do not inflate feeling, do not inflate perception, do not inflate volitional factors, do not inflate consciousness, do not inflate the earth element, do not inflate the water element,

original: me'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rlung gi khams su mi rlom pa dang / nam mkha'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / mig gi khams su mi rlom pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: me'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rlung gi khams su mi rlom pa dang / nam mkha'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / mig gi khams su mi rlom pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang /
translated: do not inflate the fire element, do not inflate the wind element, do not inflate the space element, do not inflate the consciousness element, do not inflate the eye element, do not inflate the form element,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rna ba'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / sgra'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / sna'i khams su mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rna ba'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / sgra'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / sna'i khams su mi rlom pa dang /
translated: not to be inflated about the element of the ear, not to be inflated about the element of sound, not to be inflated about the element of the ear consciousness, not to be inflated about the element of the nose,

original: dri'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / lce'i khams su @76b mi rlom pa dang / ro'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: dri'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / lce'i khams su @76b mi rlom pa dang / ro'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang /
translated: not to be inflated about the element of smell, not to be inflated about the element of the nose consciousness, not to be inflated about the element of the tongue, not to be inflated about the element of taste, not to be inflated about the element of the tongue consciousness,

original: lus kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang / reg bya'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / yid kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang / chos kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang / reg bya'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / yid kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang / chos kyi khams su mi rlom pa dang /
translated: not to be inflated about the element of the body, not to be inflated about the element of touch, not to be inflated about the element of the body consciousness, not to be inflated about the element of the mind, not to be inflated about the element of phenomena,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag par mi rlom pa dang / yang dag par spong par mi rlom pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang par mi rlom pa dang / dbang por mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su mi rlom pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag par mi rlom pa dang / yang dag par spong par mi rlom pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang par mi rlom pa dang / dbang por mi rlom pa dang /
translated: not to be conceited about the applications of mindfulness, not to be conceited about the right efforts, not to be conceited about the legs of miraculous power, not to be conceited about the faculties,

original: stobs su mi rlom pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi rlom pa dang / lam du mi rlom pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: stobs su mi rlom pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi rlom pa dang / lam du mi rlom pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang /
translated: not to be conceited about the powers, not to be conceited about the branches of awakening, not to be conceited about the path, not to be conceited about the perfection of generosity, not to be conceited about the perfection of conduct,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi rlom pa dang /
translated: not to be conceited about the perfection of patience, not to be conceited about the perfection of diligence, not to be conceited about the perfection of meditation, not to be conceited about the perfection of wisdom,🔽and

original: mi 'jigs par mi rlom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur mi rlom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du mi rlom pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bur mi rlom pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur mi rlom pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs par mi rlom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur mi rlom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du mi rlom pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bur mi rlom pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur mi rlom pa dang /
translated: They do not falsely project the ten powers of the tathāgatas, they do not falsely project the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, they do not falsely project the result of stream enterer, they do not falsely project the result of once-returner,🔽they do not falsely project the result of non-returner, they do not falsely project the state of a worthy one, they do not falsely project a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, they do not falsely project the knowledge of path aspects, and they do not falsely project unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur mi rlom pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid du mi rlom pa dang / rang byang chub tu mi rlom pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid du mi rlom pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rlom pa med pa de lta na sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur mi rlom pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid du mi rlom pa dang / rang byang chub tu mi rlom pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid du mi rlom pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rlom pa med pa de lta na sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel te /
translated: Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings like that grow in the six perfections

original: sus kyang thub pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: sus kyang thub pa med pa yin no //
translated: and no one can overcome them.”🔽“Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ armor?”

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, standing in the six perfections,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / ye shes de dang ldan pas ngan song thams cad kyi sgo bcad par 'gyur ba dang / mi dbul zhing phongs pa yang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / ye shes de dang ldan pas ngan song thams cad kyi sgo bcad par 'gyur ba dang / mi dbul zhing phongs pa yang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: perfect the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, and, endowed with that knowledge, close the doors to all bad rebirths and do not experience human poverty and destitution.

original: lus gang dang ldan pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi nang na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus @77a * //
analyzed: lus gang dang ldan pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi nang na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus @77a * //
translated: They do not take up a body that is despised in the world with its gods.

original: yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni yongs su med la bar gdams pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni yongs su med la bar gdams pa'o //
translated: ” This is the instruction in non-apprehension.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ knowledge of a knower of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes gang dang ldan pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes gang dang ldan pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being with such wisdom sees the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the world systems of the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,🔽and also sees the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the world systems of the southern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,🔽and also sees the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the world systems of the western direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: kyang mthong ngo //
translated: and also sees the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the world systems of the northern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,🔽and also sees the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the world systems of the intermediate directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,🔽and also sees the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the world systems above and below, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: de dag gis chos bstan pa yang nyan to //
analyzed: de dag gis chos bstan pa yang nyan to //
translated: He also hears the teachings of those buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the bodhisattva saṅgha and the distinctions of the qualities of the buddha realms.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, he sees as many tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River in each of the ten directions, in worlds as numerous as the sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: de dag gis chos bstan pa yang nyan to //
analyzed: de dag gis chos bstan pa yang nyan to //
translated: He hears the teachings of those tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun la yang bsnyen bkur byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun la yang bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: He serves the saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the array of the qualities of the buddha realms.

original: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: “The bodhisattva great being who has that kind of wisdom does not develop the notion of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: He does not develop the notion of a bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos kyi 'du shes mi skyed do //🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'du shes mi skyed do // rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: He does not arouse the idea of a śrāvaka.🔽He does not arouse the idea of a pratyekabuddha.

original: bdag gi 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: bdag gi 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: He does not arouse the idea of a self.

original: gzhan gyi 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: He does not arouse the idea of another.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes mi skyed do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes mi skyed do /
translated: He does not arouse the idea of a buddhafield.

original: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has that kind of wisdom practices the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: He practices the perfection of morality.🔽He practices the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: He practices the perfection of perseverance.

original: @77b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
analyzed: @77b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed /
translated: He practices the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par byed de /
translated: He practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams su dmigs pa yang med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams su dmigs pa yang med do //
translated: He does not apprehend the perfections.

original: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom par byed de /
analyzed: ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has such gnosis cultivates the applications of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams su dmigs pa yang med do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams su dmigs pa yang med do //
translated: He does not apprehend the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam sgom par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam sgom par byed de /
translated: He cultivates the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, and the path.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam du dmigs pa yang med do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam du dmigs pa yang med do //
translated: He does not apprehend the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, and the path.

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sgrub par byed la /
translated: He accomplishes the strengths, the fearlessnesses, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su dmigs pa yang med do //
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su dmigs pa yang med do //
translated: He does not apprehend the strengths, the fearlessnesses, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sh'a ra'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ye shes te /
analyzed: sh'a ra'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ye shes te /
translated: “Śāriputra, this is the knowledge of bodhisattva great beings.

original: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who have that knowledge complete all the qualities of a buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad du yang rlom pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lam yongs su 'dzin pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad du yang rlom pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lam yongs su 'dzin pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: and yet they do not think about any of the qualities of a buddha.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag mig lnga rab tu thob pa dang yongs su sbyong ba yod do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag mig lnga rab tu thob pa dang yongs su sbyong ba yod do //
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who have attained and purified the five eyes.

original: mig gang lnga rab tu thob pa dang yongs su spyod zhe na /
analyzed: mig gang lnga rab tu thob pa dang yongs su spyod zhe na /
translated: What are the five eyes that they have attained and purified?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go //
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go //
translated: the flesh eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: Bhagavān, what is the purified flesh eye of bodhisattva mahāsattvas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gang gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do //🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gang gis dpag tshad nyis brgya dang / sum brgya dang / bzhi brgya dang / lnga brgya dang / stong gi bar du mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gang gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gang gis dpag tshad nyis brgya dang / sum brgya dang / bzhi brgya dang / lnga brgya dang / stong gi bar du mthong ba yod do //
translated: The Bhagavān replied,🔽“Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas whose flesh eye sees for a hundred yojanas.🔽Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas whose flesh eye sees for two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, five hundred, up to a thousand yojanas.

original: @78a * // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: @78a * // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling mthong ba yod do //
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas whose flesh eye sees Jambudvīpa.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig gis gling gnyis dang / gling gsum dang / gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //🔽sha'i mig gang gis stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //🔽sha'i mig gang gis stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig gis gling gnyis dang / gling gsum dang / gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do // sha'i mig gang gis stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do // sha'i mig gang gis stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
translated: three continents,🔽four continents,

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings whose fleshly eye sees a world system of a billion worlds.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Śāriputra, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure fleshly eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure divine eye?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings whose divine eye sees the entire billion-world great billion-world universe.

original: sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //🔽'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so // 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the divine eye of the gods of the Thirty-Three.🔽He knows the divine eye of the Yāma gods.🔽He knows the divine eye of the Tuṣita gods.

original: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //🔽'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so // 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the divine eye of the Nirmāṇarati gods.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the divine eye of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //🔽tshangs pa mdun na 'don gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so // tshangs pa mdun na 'don gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The divine eye of the Brahmakāyika gods is known by the bodhisattva.🔽The divine eye of the Brahmapurohita gods is known by the bodhisattva.

original: tshangs 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //🔽tshangs chen gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshangs 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so // tshangs chen gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The divine eye of the Brahmapārṣada gods is known by the bodhisattva.🔽The divine eye of the Mahābrahmā gods is known by the bodhisattva.

original: 'od chung gi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems @78b dpas rab tu shes so //🔽tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'od chung gi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems @78b dpas rab tu shes so // tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The divine eye of the Parīttābha gods is known by the bodhisattva.🔽The divine eye of the Apramāṇābha gods is known by the bodhisattva.

original: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The divine eye of the Ābhāsvara gods is known by the bodhisattva.

original: dge chung gi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge chung gi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of Lesser Virtue.

original: tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of Immeasurable Virtue.

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of Vast Virtue.

original: sprin med kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sprin med kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of Cloudless.

original: bsod nams skyes kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bsod nams skyes kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of Increased Merit.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of Great Fruit.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of No-thought.

original: mi spong ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mi spong ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods who do not waste.

original: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //🔽legs mthong gi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so // legs mthong gi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods without affliction.🔽The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of excellent vision.

original: rab lta'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab lta'i lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of good vision.

original: 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
