translated: Because that higher knowing of the knowledge of the realization of the destruction of the outflows by which they would become arrogant is not apprehended, because of the emptiness of inherent existence, because of the isolation of inherent existence, and because of the nonapprehension of inherent existence.

original: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi bsam pa'am /
analyzed: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi bsam pa'am /
translated: It is the intention to attain the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants, except for the attention of omniscience.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i ye shes mngon du sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba'i ye shes mngon du sgrub pa'i bsam pa tsam yang mi skyed do //
translated: Except for the thought of omniscience, he does not even give rise to the thought of the knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants, let alone the thought of actualizing the knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: actualizes the knowledge of the superknowledges that actualizes the knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod cing mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod cing mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way completes and purifies the six superknowledges.

original: sh'a ri'i bu mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs shing yongs su dag pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtod par byed do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs shing yongs su dag pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtod par byed do //
translated: Śāriputra, one who has perfected and purified the superknowledges directs the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las @85b 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las @85b 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: they abide in the perfection of generosity and, because of non-fixation due to the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
translated: they also train on the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: they abide in the perfection of morality and, because of being free from downfalls and non-downfalls due to the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bdag kyang yod do //
translated: They are the ones who train in the path to omniscience.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: abide in the perfection of patience

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: and train in the path to omniscience by means of the emptiness of the unlimited, because they are unperturbed.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: They are the ones who train in the path to omniscience.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: abide in the perfection of perseverance and train in the path to omniscience by means of the emptiness of the unlimited, because they do not slacken in their physical and mental perseverance.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: who stand in the perfection of concentration, because their minds are undistracted by the emptiness that transcends limits,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: are those who train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis shes rab 'chal pa'i sems yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis shes rab 'chal pa'i sems yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: who stand in the perfection of wisdom, because they have abandoned the thought of bad wisdom by the emptiness that transcends limits,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: are those who train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @86a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @86a * //
translated: Śāriputra, in this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: they purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects by means of the emptiness that transcends extremes, because it is free from coming and free from going, and because it is free from grasping.

original: de la sbyin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa la brten nas gdags so //
translated: In this regard, giving is imputed in dependence on grasping.

original: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims 'chal pa la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims 'chal pa la brten nas gdags so //
translated: Morality is imputed in dependence on immorality.

original: bzod pa ni mi bzod pa la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: bzod pa ni mi bzod pa la brten nas gdags so //
translated: Patience is imputed in dependence on impatience.

original: brtson 'grus ni le lo la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni le lo la brten nas gdags so //
translated: Effort is imputed in dependence on laziness.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa la brten nas gdags so //
translated: Concentration is imputed in dependence on distraction.

original: shes rab ni shes rab 'chal pa la brten nas gdags te /
analyzed: shes rab ni shes rab 'chal pa la brten nas gdags te /
translated: Wisdom is imputed in dependence on stupidity.

original: de ni rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: de ni rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘I have crossed over.’

original: ma brgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: ma brgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘I have not crossed over.’

original: sbyin pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa zhes rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa zhes rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘Giving and grasping.’

original: tshul khrims dang tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes rlom sems med do //🔽bzod pa dang 'khrug pa zhes rlom sems med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes rlom sems med do // bzod pa dang 'khrug pa zhes rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘Moral conduct and immorality.’🔽He does not think, ‘Patience and anger.’

original: brtson 'grus dang le lo zhes rlom sems med do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang le lo zhes rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘Exertion and laziness.’

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes rlom sems med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘Concentration and distraction.’

original: shes rab dang shes rab 'chal pa zhes rlom sems med do //🔽bdag la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: shes rab dang shes rab 'chal pa zhes rlom sems med do // bdag la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘Wisdom and stupidity.’🔽He does not think, ‘I have been reviled.’

original: bdag la phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽bkur sti byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: bdag la phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // bkur sti byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, ‘I have been honored.’🔽He does not think, ‘I have been respected.’

original: bkur sti ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do//
analyzed: bkur sti ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do//
translated: He does not think, ‘I have not been respected.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu ma skyes pa ni nga la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽nga la phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu ma skyes pa ni nga la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // nga la phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: Śāriputra, I do not think, ‘Someone has reviled me,’🔽I do not think, ‘Someone has paid me homage,’

original: nga la bkur sti byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: nga la bkur sti byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: I do not think, ‘Someone has honored me,’

original: nga la bkur sti ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: nga la bkur sti ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: I do not think, ‘Someone has not honored me.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rlom sems thams cad yang dag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rlom sems thams cad yang dag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that way the perfection of wisdom completely eliminates all conceit.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: yon tan gang dag yod pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med do //
analyzed: yon tan gang dag yod pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med do //
translated: the qualities they have are not present in any of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When they perfect those qualities,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: they also bring beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
translated: they also purify a buddhafield,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
translated: and they also attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab @86b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab @86b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed de /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽generate the thought of sameness toward all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed nas /
translated: having generated the thought of sameness toward all sentient beings,

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob bo //
translated: they attain the sameness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sems can thams cad rab tu dgod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sems can thams cad rab tu dgod do //
translated: Having attained the sameness of all phenomena, they establish all sentient beings in the sameness of all phenomena.

original: de ni tshe 'di nyid la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs su byon cing dben par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni tshe 'di nyid la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs su byon cing dben par bya ba yin te /
translated: In this very life they are approved of and praised by the lord buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang yid du 'ong zhing dben par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang yid du 'ong zhing dben par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is pleasing and secluded to all bodhisattvas, to all śrāvakas, and to all pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ni skye ba gang dang gang du skyes kyang de dang de dag tu nam yang mig gis yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ni skye ba gang dang gang du skyes kyang de dang de dag tu nam yang mig gis yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs mi mthong ngo //
translated: Wherever he is born, there he never sees with his eyes an unpleasant form.

original: rna bas yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi thos so //🔽snas yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri mi tshor ro //
analyzed: rna bas yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi thos so // snas yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri mi tshor ro //
translated: He never hears with his ears an unpleasant sound.🔽He never smells with his nose an unpleasant smell.

original: lces yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro mi myang ngo //
analyzed: lces yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro mi myang ngo //
translated: He never tastes with his tongue an unpleasant taste.

original: lus kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya mi reg go //
analyzed: lus kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya mi reg go //
translated: He never touches with his body an unpleasant tangible object.

original: yid kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rnam par rig pa med do //
analyzed: yid kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rnam par rig pa med do //
translated: He never cognizes with his mind an unpleasant mental object.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Sariputra, a Bodhisattva-mahasattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: When this perfection of wisdom was being taught,

original: dge slong sum brgyas gos gyon gyon pa bcom ldan 'das la yon du gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong sum brgyas gos gyon gyon pa bcom ldan 'das la yon du gsol to //
translated: three hundred monks laid down their bodies as offerings to the World-Honored One.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: They all vowed to seek the unsurpassed way.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do//🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do// de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
translated: At that time, the World-Honored One smiled.

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na bde logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te / bcom ldan 'das gang na bde logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
translated: Then the Venerable Ananda rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee,🔽joined his palms in respect, and said to the Buddha:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: World-Honored One, why did you smile?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas do not smile without cause or condition.

original: zhal 'dzum pa mdzad pa 'di'i rgyu ci lags /
analyzed: zhal 'dzum pa mdzad pa 'di'i rgyu ci lags /
translated: What is the cause of this smile?

original: rkyen ci lags /
analyzed: rkyen ci lags /
translated: What are the conditions?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la @87a * //🔽'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la @87a * // 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig 'das nas bskal pa skar ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dpal chen po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig 'das nas bskal pa skar ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dpal chen po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du
translated: “Ānanda, after sixty-one eons have passed, during the eon called Star-like, these three hundred monks will become thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas all named Great Glory.

original: 'byung ngo // 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyo'o //
analyzed: 'byung ngo // 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyo'o //
translated: They will be reborn in the buddha realm of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya.

original: chos bstan pa 'dis yongs su smin par byas pa'i lha'i bu stong phrag drug cu gang dang gang dag yin pa de dang de dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa'i thad du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'dis yongs su smin par byas pa'i lha'i bu stong phrag drug cu gang dang gang dag yin pa de dang de dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa'i thad du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar
translated: The sixty thousand gods who have been ripened by this teaching will pass into parinirvāṇa in the presence of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Maitreya.

original: 'gyur ro // de nyid du rab tu byung nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de nyid du rab tu byung nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: They will go forth right there and practice pure conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The thus-gone Maitreya will prophesy their unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor nas 'khor bzhi po rnams kyis shar phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor nas 'khor bzhi po rnams kyis shar phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Then, by the power of the Buddha, the fourfold assembly in the circle of the assembly of the Bhagavat Śākyamuni saw a thousand buddhas in the eastern direction.

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //🔽nub phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo // nub phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, they saw a thousand buddhas in the southern direction.🔽They saw a thousand buddhas in the western direction.

original: byang phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //🔽byang shar gyi phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo // byang shar gyi phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
translated: They saw a thousand buddhas in the northern direction.🔽They saw a thousand buddhas in the northeastern direction.

original: shar lho'i phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //🔽lho nub kyi phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
analyzed: shar lho'i phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo // lho nub kyi phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
translated: They saw a thousand buddhas in the southeastern direction.🔽They saw a thousand buddhas in the southwestern direction.

original: nub byang gi phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
analyzed: nub byang gi phyogs su sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
translated: They saw a thousand buddhas in the northwestern direction.🔽They saw a thousand buddhas in the lower direction.

original: 'og dang steng gi phyogs re rer sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'og dang steng gi phyogs re rer sangs rgyas stong mthong ngo //
translated: They saw a thousand buddhas in the upper direction.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi bkod pa chen po mthong ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi bkod pa chen po mthong ste /
translated: They saw the great array of the good qualities of the buddha-fields.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi bkod pa mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa de dag ni mi mjed 'di na yod par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi bkod pa mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa de dag ni mi mjed 'di na yod par ma mthong ngo //
translated: They saw the array of qualities of the buddhafields of the bhagavat buddhas of the ten directions, but they did not see the array of qualities of the buddhafields in this Sahā world.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor nas srog chags stong phrag bcus bdag cag gi las gang byas pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las spyad @87b par bya'o zhes smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor nas srog chags stong phrag bcus bdag cag gi las gang byas pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las spyad @87b par bya'o zhes smon lam btab bo //
translated: Then, from the circle of the assembly of the bhagavat Śākyamuni, ten thousand beings made the aspiration, “We will practice the kind of conduct that will cause us to be reborn in those buddhafields.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas de'i tshe zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the bhagavat, knowing the thoughts of those sons of good family, smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: “Blessed One, since the blessed buddhas do not smile without cause or condition,

original: zhal 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ci lags /
analyzed: zhal 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ci lags /
translated: what is the cause of your smile?

original: rkyen ci lags /
analyzed: rkyen ci lags /
translated: What is the condition?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyis srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyis srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag mthong ngam /
translated: “Ānanda, do you see these ten thousand beings?”

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: “Blessed One, I see them.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Ānanda, after these ten thousand beings die, they will be reborn in this and that buddhafield.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang nam du yang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang nam du yang mi 'bral te /
translated: They will never be separated from the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas.

original: de nas phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bkod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bkod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then in the future they will appear in the world as Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, all named King of Array.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po ste /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po ste /
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, the Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, the Venerable Subhūti, the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: de dag dang mngon par shes pa mngon par shes pa'i dge slong gzhan rab tu mang po rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu mang ba dag dang / dge slong dag dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang /
analyzed: de dag dang mngon par shes pa mngon par shes pa'i dge slong gzhan rab tu mang po rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu mang ba dag dang / dge slong dag dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang /
translated: and many other monks who had attained the superknowledges, many bodhisattva mahāsattvas, monks, nuns, laymen,

original: dge bsnyen ma shin tu mang ba dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma shin tu mang ba dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and laywomen made a request to the Blessed One, saying:🔽Bhagavān, we will uphold this Dharma teaching in this buddha realm of Sahā after the nirvāṇa of the Tathāgata.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen po lags te 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rab lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen po lags te 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rab lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection, namely the perfection of wisdom.🔽This perfection is excellent.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni khyad par du @88a * //🔽'phags pa lags so //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mchog lags so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni khyad par du @88a * // 'phags pa lags so // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mchog lags so //
translated: This perfection is exalted.🔽This perfection is supreme.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rab mchog lags so //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bla na med pa lags so //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gong na med pa lags so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rab mchog lags so // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bla na med pa lags so // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gong na med pa lags so //
translated: This perfection is the best of the best.🔽This perfection is unsurpassed.🔽This perfection is unequaled.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mnyam pa med pa lags so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mnyam pa med pa lags so //
translated: This perfection is incomparable.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nam mkha' lta bu lags so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nam mkha' lta bu lags so //
translated: This perfection is like space.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid lags so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid lags so //
translated: This perfection is the emptiness of its own mark.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa lags so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa lags so //
translated: This perfection is endowed with all good qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni brdzi ba ma mchis pa lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni brdzi ba ma mchis pa lags te /
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is invincible.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom give a gift that is equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
translated: They complete the perfection of generosity that is equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob po //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob po //
translated: They attain a body that is equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They attain the Dharma that is equal to the unequaled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is🔽this perfection of wisdom.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims bsrungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims bsrungs so //
translated: They have guarded morality that is equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
translated: They have completed the perfection of morality that is equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
translated: They have attained a body that is equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They have attained the Dharma that is equal to the unequalled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa bsgoms so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa bsgoms so //
translated: They have cultivated patience that is equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
translated: They have completed the perfection of patience that is equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
translated: They have attained a body that is equal to the unequalled.

analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They have attained the Dharma that is equal to the unequaled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely:

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo // de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams so//
translated: unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽They have undertaken the practice of the perfection of effort that is equal to the unequaled.

original: @88b de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: @88b de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
translated: They have completed the perfection of effort that is equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
translated: They have attained a body that is equal to the unequaled.

analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They have attained the Dharma that is equal to the unequaled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bsam gtan bskyed do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bsam gtan bskyed do //
translated: They have generated the concentration that is equal to the unequaled.

analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //

analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang na nyam pa'i lus thob bo //
translated: They have attained a body that is unequalled and equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They have attained the Dharma that is unequalled and equal to the unequalled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab bsgoms so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab bsgoms so //
translated: They have cultivated wisdom that is unequalled and equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
translated: They have perfected the perfection of wisdom that is unequalled and equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob bo //
translated: They have attained a body that is unequalled and equal to the unequalled.

original: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the Dharma that is unequalled and equal to the unequalled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs brnyes par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs brnyes par gyur to //
translated: Blessed One, you too, by practicing this very perfection of wisdom, have attained form that is unequalled and equal to the unequalled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa brnyes par gyur to //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa brnyes par gyur to //
translated: He attained feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that are equal to the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i byang chub mngon par byang chub nas /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i byang chub mngon par byang chub nas /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening that is equal to the unequaled,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gyur to //🔽de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur to //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gyur to // de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur to // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he turned the wheel of the Dharma that is equal to the unequaled.🔽In the same way, the lord buddhas of the past, present, and future, having practiced this very perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened, will fully awaken, and are fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: They have fully awakened, will fully awaken, and are fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar lags pa de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'tshal @89a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar lags pa de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'tshal @89a * //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings who wish to perfect all dharmas

original: bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyi'o //
translated: should exert themselves in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi ba lags so //
translated: Blessed One, those bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom are to be revered by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chen po de dag thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag thams cad la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chen po de dag thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag thams cad la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to all those great hearers and all those bodhisattva great beings,

original: rigs kyi bu dag de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: “Noble sons, it is so!🔽It is just as you have said!

original: ji skad du smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said!”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings practicing this perfection of wisdom are worthy of worship by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas mi'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas mi'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, relying on this perfection of wisdom, the human world appears in the world.

original: lha'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The god world appears in the world.

translated: the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, the gods of the Heaven of Joy, the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the gods of the Brahmā group, the gods who are attendants of the Brahmā group,

translated: the gods of the retinue of the Brahmā group, the gods of great Brahmā, the gods of limited radiance, the gods of immeasurable radiance, the gods of complete radiance, the gods of limited virtue, the gods of immeasurable virtue,

translated: the gods of the class of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the gods of Joyous, the gods of Excellent Vision, the gods of Limited Virtue, the gods of Extensive Virtue, the gods of Cloudless, the gods of Merit Born, the gods of Great Fruit, the gods of the Sphere of No-thought, the gods of No-Hardship, the gods of No-Affliction,🔽the gods of Good Vision, the gods of Excellent Vision, the Akaniṣṭha gods, the gods of the sphere of infinite space, the gods of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the gods of the sphere of nothingness,🔽

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the gods of the Heaven of Excellent Understanding, the gods of the Heaven of Excellent Retinue, the gods of the Heaven of the Masters of Others’ Creations, the gods of the Heaven of Brahmā’s Ministers, the gods of Brahmā’s Assembly, the gods of Great Brahmā, the gods of Limited Radiance, the gods of Immeasurable Radiance, the gods of Luminous Radiance, the gods of Limited Virtue, the gods of Immeasurable Virtue, the gods of Vast Virtue, the gods of Cloudless Virtue, the gods of Manifested Virtue, the gods of Great Fruit, the gods of the Plane of No-thought, the gods of No-Hardship, the gods of Good Vision, the gods of Excellent Vision, the gods of Akaniṣṭha, the gods of the Sphere of Infinite Space, the gods of the Sphere of Infinite Consciousness, the gods of the Sphere of Nothingness, and the gods of the Sphere of Neither Perception nor Non-Perception appear in the world.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the stream-enterers, the once-returners, the non-returners, the arhats, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, and the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas appear in the world.

original: rigs kyi bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas dkon mchog gsum po rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas dkon mchog gsum po rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sons of noble family, it is on the basis of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas that the Three Jewels appear in the world.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad thams cad de bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / mal stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman gyi yo byad rnams dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad thams cad de bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / mal stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman gyi yo byad rnams dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang /
translated: All the worldly necessities of life, such as food and drink, clothing and bedding, medicine for illness, and the requisites of life, as well as jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells,

original: men shel dang / byi ru dang / gser dang / dngul dag kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: men shel dang / byi ru dang / gser dang / dngul dag kyang 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: crystal, coral, gold, and silver will appear in the world.

original: rigs kyi bu dag lha rdzas kyi bde ba'i cha rkyen thams cad nas mi ma yin pa rnams kyi srid pa'i bde pa rnams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba rnams dang / de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag lha rdzas kyi bde ba'i cha rkyen thams cad nas mi ma yin pa rnams kyi srid pa'i bde pa rnams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba rnams dang / de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Sons of noble family, all the conditions for the happiness of the gods, the happiness of non-humans, the happiness of saṃsāra, and the happiness of nirvāṇa will appear in the world because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu dag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: “Sons of noble family, bodhisattvas who practice bodhisattva conduct connect beings to the six perfections.

original: sbyin pa sbyin du 'jug go //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin du 'jug go //
translated: They give them gifts.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par len du 'jug go //🔽bzod pa la 'god do //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par len du 'jug go // bzod pa la 'god do //
translated: They make them take up discipline.🔽They establish them in patience.

original: brtson 'grus la nges par sbyor ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la nges par sbyor ro //
translated: They make them persevere.

original: bsam gtan la rab tu gnas par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan la rab tu gnas par byed do //
translated: He establishes them in meditative concentration.

original: shes rab la yang dag par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: shes rab la yang dag par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He connects them with wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas sems can thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas sems can thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: And it is on the basis of the bodhisattva that all sentient beings practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu dag de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Therefore, sons of noble family, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva

analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du zhugs pa @90a * //
translated: is engaged in the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.”

analyzed: yin no // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, extended his tongue and

analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ljags kyi dbang pos khyab par mdzad do //
translated: covered this trichiliocosm with it.

original: de nas de'i tshe ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs su ldan pa mang po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs su ldan pa mang po byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then, at that time, from that tongue many lights of various colors and various arrays issued forth.

original: byung nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //🔽de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: byung nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to // de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: Having arisen, it pervaded with a great light the world systems in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.🔽In the same way, it pervaded with a great light the world systems in the southern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, and in the western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, and northwestern directions, below and above, each one as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: de nas shar phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams nas byang chub sems dpa' gzhal du med grangs med pa rnams kyis 'od kyi tshogs de mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams nas byang chub sems dpa' gzhal du med grangs med pa rnams kyis 'od kyi tshogs de mthong nas /
translated: Then, from the eastern direction up to the zenith, the bodhisattvas in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, having seen that mass of light,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis 'di lta bur 'od kyis gsal bar snang ba 'di su'i mthu lags zhes rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhus par gyur to //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis 'di lta bur 'od kyis gsal bar snang ba 'di su'i mthu lags zhes rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhus par gyur to // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Bhagavān, whose power is it that illuminates this realm with such light?”🔽Those bhagavān buddhas of their buddha realms replied to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, “Noble sons, in the west, in the direction of the setting sun, there is a world realm named Sahā.

original: rigs kyi bu dag 'di ni nub phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi cha'i bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod pa na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag 'di ni nub phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi cha'i bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod pa na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho
translated: In it there is a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha named Śākyamuni.🔽He is alive, lives on, and remains there.

original: skyong ste / des zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
analyzed: skyong ste / des zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
translated: He has extended his tongue and

original: shar phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'od kyis snang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: shar phyogs nas steng gi phyogs kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'od kyis snang bar mdzad do //
translated: He illuminates the world systems in the eastern direction, and likewise the world systems in the southern, western and northern directions, in the intermediate directions, and up to the zenith and the nadir.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: And he illuminates the world systems in the eastern direction, and likewise the world systems in the southern, western and northern directions, in the intermediate directions, and up to the zenith and the nadir.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, and in order to demonstrate it,

original: de ltar phyogs bcu rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs bcu rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: in this way he illuminates the world systems in the ten directions, as many as there are, with his radiance.

original: byang chub sems @90b dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems @90b dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas said to those Buddha-Bhagavans:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de lta ba dang / de la phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de lta ba dang / de la phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang /
translated: Bhagavān, I too will go to that Sahā world realm in order to see the Tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni, to pay homage to him, to honor him,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu nas 'dus pa de dag kyang lta ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mnyan pa'i slad du mchi'o //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu nas 'dus pa de dag kyang lta ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mnyan pa'i slad du mchi'o // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and to see the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have gathered from the ten directions, and to hear the Dharma from them.”🔽The buddha bhagavāns replied, “Noble sons, if you know that the time is right, then go.”

original: rigs kyi bu dag da ltar de'i dus la bab par shes na song shig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis phyogs bcu rnams nas me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag da ltar de'i dus la bab par shes na song shig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis phyogs bcu rnams nas me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang /
translated: Then those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, from the ten directions, brought flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments,

original: phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyal mtshan rnams khyer zhing rin po che sna tshogs dang / gser dang / dngul dang / me tog gi lan bu rnams kyang khyer nas glu dang /
analyzed: phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyal mtshan rnams khyer zhing rin po che sna tshogs dang / gser dang / dngul dang / me tog gi lan bu rnams kyang khyer nas glu dang /
translated: They carried various kinds of incense, flowers, parasols, victory banners, flags, and banners of total victory, as well as various kinds of jewels, gold, silver, and flower garlands.

original: rol mo brdung ba dkrol ba mang pos bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa gang na ba der dong bar gyur to //
analyzed: rol mo brdung ba dkrol ba mang pos bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa gang na ba der dong bar gyur to //
translated: With many songs and the sounds of musical instruments, they went to the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Śākyamuni.

original: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang /

translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the Heaven of Brahmā, the Heaven of Brahmā’s Ministers, the Heaven of Brahmā’s Retinue,

original: tshangs chen dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge ba dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang /
