translated: Great Brahma,🔽Lesser,🔽Immeasurable Radiance,🔽Clear Light,🔽Virtuous,🔽Immeasurable Virtue,🔽Abundant Virtue,🔽Cloudless,🔽Born of Virtue,🔽Great Result,🔽and the Formless Realm of Infinite Space,🔽Infinite Consciousness,🔽Nothing Whatsoever,🔽and Neither Discernment Nor Nondiscernment.🔽

original: mi spong ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / legs mthong dang / rab lta dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyis lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang /🔽lha rdzas kyi me tog autpala dang / padmo dang / ku mu da dang / @91a * //
analyzed: mi spong ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / legs mthong dang / rab lta dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyis lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / bdug spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog autpala dang / padmo dang / ku mu da dang / @91a * //
translated: the gods of the Heaven of Great Fruition, the Heaven of the Highest Peak of Existence, the Heaven of the Four Kings, the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the Heaven of Brahma’s Ministers, the Heaven of Brahma’s Priests, the Heaven of Great Brahma, the Heaven of Limited Radiance, the Heaven of Immeasurable Radiance, the Heaven of Radiant Splendor, the Heaven of Limited Virtue, the Heaven of Immeasurable Virtue, the Heaven of Vast Virtue, the Heaven of No Hardship, the Heaven of No Heat, the Heaven of Clear Light, the Heaven of Perfect View, the Heaven of Excellent View, and the Heaven of the Highest of the High.🔽They brought divine flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders,🔽divine flowers such as utpala, padma, kumuda,

original: punda r'i ka dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog manda ra ba dang / manda ra ba chen po dang / ke sa ra dang / ta ma la'i 'dab ma mang po khyer te /
analyzed: punda r'i ka dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog manda ra ba dang / manda ra ba chen po dang / ke sa ra dang / ta ma la'i 'dab ma mang po khyer te /
translated: and pundarīka, as well as divine flowers such as mandārava and great mandārava, and keśara and tamāla leaves.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ga na ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ga na ba der dong ngo //
translated: and they went to the place where the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha Śākyamuni was staying.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha de dag gis me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha de dag gis me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: Then the bodhisattva great beings and the gods scattered flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners,

original: lha'i ba dan de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la gtor to //
analyzed: lha'i ba dan de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la gtor to //
translated: and divine flags over the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha Śākyamuni.

original: mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: mngon par gtor to //
translated: They scattered them again and again.

original: de nas me tog la sogs pa de dag stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: de nas me tog la sogs pa de dag stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: Then those flowers and so forth rose up into the sky above this great trichiliocosm,

original: me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa gru bzhi pa /
analyzed: me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa gru bzhi pa /
translated: forming a square flower pavilion

original: ka ba bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ka ba bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: with four pillars,

original: cha kun tu mnyam pa /
analyzed: cha kun tu mnyam pa /
translated: It was completely level,

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba mdangs dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar red de 'dug go //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba mdangs dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar red de 'dug go //
translated: very open, delightful, and pleasing.

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma stan las langs nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar zhing pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma stan las langs nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar zhing pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /
translated: Then, from within that assembly, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of living beings rose from their seats, draped their upper robes over one shoulder, and knelt on their right knees.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
translated: With palms placed together they bowed to the Blessed One

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces /
translated: and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis kyang de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji lta bar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis chos rnams thob par bgyi zhing de ltar bcom ldan 'das chos ston par mdzad pa ji lta bar
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis kyang de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji lta bar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis chos rnams thob par bgyi zhing de ltar bcom ldan 'das chos ston par mdzad pa ji lta bar
translated: “Blessed One, we too will attain the Dharma that has the same nature as the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha. In the same way that the Blessed One teaches the Dharma,

original: 'khor 'di lta bur chos bstan par bgyi'o zhes gsol to //
analyzed: 'khor 'di lta bur chos bstan par bgyi'o zhes gsol to //
translated: we too will teach the Dharma to such an assembly.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts of those sons of good family,

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang 'byung ba med pa la bzod par gyur pa yang mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang 'byung ba med pa la bzod par gyur pa yang mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: and knowing that they had attained acceptance of all phenomena as unborn, unceasing, non-arising, and non-occurring, smiled.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa byung ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa byung ste /
translated: Then from the Blessed One's mouth, various colored light rays emerged,

original: de dag gis thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten 'di la @91b bskor ba byas nas yang slar 'dus nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub par gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten 'di la @91b bskor ba byas nas yang slar 'dus nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub par gyur to //
translated: and after circling this entire world, they re-converged and disappeared into the crown of the Blessed One's head.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /🔽bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te / bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat,🔽put his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
translated: With palms joined, he bowed to the Blessed One🔽and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: “Lord, the Lord Buddhas do not smile without a cause or condition.

original: zhal 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ci lags /
analyzed: zhal 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ci lags /
translated: What is the cause of the smile?

original: rkyen ci lags /
analyzed: rkyen ci lags /
translated: What is the condition?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: kun dga' bo 'khor 'di'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'khor 'di'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: “Ānanda, from within this assembly, a hundred thousand quintillion beings have attained receptivity to the nonarising of dharmas.

original: de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bskal pa bye ba phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad na bskal pa me tog gi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi yan lag me tog ces
analyzed: de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bskal pa bye ba phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad na bskal pa me tog gi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi yan lag me tog ces
translated: In the future, after eight quintillion eons have passed, during the eon called Flower Origin, they will all appear in the world as tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened, complete buddhas called Flower of Enlightenment.

original: bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa'o //
translated: ” This is the instruction on the six superknowledges.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te /
translated: Then the Lord at that time said to the venerable Subhuti:🔽Subhuti, you should expound the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, beginning with just what the perfection of wisdom is, and how the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar spobs par gyis shig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar spobs par gyis shig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, the great disciples,🔽and the gods in the assembly had this thought:

original: lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du ci tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab kyi spobs pa'i stobs bskyed pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam /
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du ci tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab kyi spobs pa'i stobs bskyed pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam /
translated: Will the venerable Subhuti expound the perfection of wisdom by the power of his own cognition and eloquence, or by the power of the Buddha?

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par 'gyur snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas tshe dang @92a * //🔽ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par 'gyur snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas tshe dang @92a * // ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s power, the venerable Su­bhūti, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those bodhisattvas, those great spiritual heroes, those great śrāvakas, and those sons of gods, said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams gang cung zad 'chad pa dang ston pa dang nye bar ston pa de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu'i mthur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams gang cung zad 'chad pa dang ston pa dang nye bar ston pa de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu'i mthur rig par bya'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, whatever the Blessed One’s śrāvakas teach, demonstrate, and disclose, all of that should be known as the Tathāgata’s power.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa'i chos de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bslabs pas na chos nyid de mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa'i chos de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bslabs pas na chos nyid de mngon sum du byed do //
translated: Thus, the Lord’s disciples train in those dharmas which the Tathagata has taught, and they realize that reality.

original: chos nyid de mngon sum du byas nas gang dang gang nyid 'chad pa dang ston pa dang nye bar ston pa de dag thams cad chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: chos nyid de mngon sum du byas nas gang dang gang nyid 'chad pa dang ston pa dang nye bar ston pa de dag thams cad chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Having realized that reality, whatever they explain, teach, and demonstrate, all that is not in conflict with reality.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa yin te /
translated: “This, Śāriputra, is the Tathāgata’s teaching of the perfection of wisdom by skillful means to the bodhisattva great beings.🔽“Śāriputra, this teaching of the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings is not the domain of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction and setting forth on the path of seeing.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs na /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, you speak of a ‘bodhisattva,’

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di chos gang gi tshig bla dags lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di chos gang gi tshig bla dags lags te /
translated: but whose name is this, namely, ‘bodhisattva’?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi /
translated: namely, ‘bodhisattva.’

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni chos de yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni chos de yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: Lord, I do not see that dharma which is called ‘bodhisattva.’

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'o //
translated: namely, ‘bodhisattva.’

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhing /
translated: Lord, in that way I do not see a bodhisattva at all,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mi dmigs na /
translated: and I do not apprehend the perfection of wisdom either.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhig gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhig gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
translated: So which bodhisattva should I instruct and admonish in which perfection of wisdom?”🔽“Subhūti, you should instruct and admonish a bodhisattva who is not seen,🔽and you should instruct and admonish the perfection of wisdom that is not apprehended.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all dharmas are empty, what is it that is appropriated, and what is it that appropriates?

original: rab 'byor 'di ni ming tsam yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni ming tsam yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just a name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is just a designation, namely,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‘bodhisattva’ and ‘perfection of wisdom.’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming de yang @92b nang na yang med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming de yang @92b nang na yang med /
translated: That name ‘bodhisattva’ is not apprehended as something internal,

original: phyi rol na yang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na yang med /
translated: not apprehended as something external,

original: gnyis ka las gzhan du yang mi dmigs so //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: gnyis ka las gzhan du yang mi dmigs so // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: not apprehended as something other than the two.

original: sems can sems can zhes brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can sems can zhes brjod mod kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just as when ‘sentient being’ is said,

original: sems can ni 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can ni 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: yet no sentient being is apprehended at all.

original: de'i ming gang yin pa de ni btags pa tsam dang / btags pa'i chos dang / btags par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ming gang yin pa de ni btags pa tsam dang / btags pa'i chos dang / btags par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: That name is just a designation, a dharma that is a designation, and it exists as a designation.”

original: btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du byed pa ma gtogs par skye ba med cing 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du byed pa ma gtogs par skye ba med cing 'gag pa med do //
translated: That designation is a mere nominal designation, and apart from that it is neither produced nor stopped.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos te /
translated: In the same way, all these—self, living being, creature, person, humankind, human, one who does, one who feels, one who knows, one who sees—are designated phenomena.

original: 'di thams cad ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa nas ming gis tha snyad du byed pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa nas ming gis tha snyad du byed pa'i bar yin no //
translated: All of these are neither produced nor stopped, up to are nominally designated by names.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos te /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, all these—the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name of a bodhisattva—are designated phenomena.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa nas ming tsam gyis tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa nas ming tsam gyis tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: All these are non-arising and unceasing, and are merely designated by names.

original: rab 'byor yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //

translated: “Subhūti, the so-called element of the mind, element of dharmas, and element of mind consciousness are simply designations of dharmas.

original: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: That designation as a dharma is also not produced and does not stop, except for the sake of designation by means of a name.

original: de dag kyang nang ma yin /
analyzed: de dag kyang nang ma yin /
translated: It is not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: it is not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
translated: and it is not apprehended apart from the two.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
translated: “Subhūti, similarly, this designation as a ‘perfection of wisdom,’ this designation as a ‘bodhisattva,’ and this designation as a ‘name of a bodhisattva’ are just designations as dharmas.

original: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: That designation as a dharma is also not produced and does not stop, except for the sake of designation by means of a name.

original: ming de yang nang ma yin /
analyzed: ming de yang nang ma yin /
translated: That name is not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: it is not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
translated: and it is not apprehended apart from the two.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: nang gi lus zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du gdags pa yin zhing mgo dang / mgrin pa dang / thal gong dang / phrag pa dang / dpung pa dang / sgal tshigs dang / sog pa dang / rtsib ma dang /
analyzed: nang gi lus zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du gdags pa yin zhing mgo dang / mgrin pa dang / thal gong dang / phrag pa dang / dpung pa dang / sgal tshigs dang / sog pa dang / rtsib ma dang /
translated: The so-called ‘inner body’ is a conventional designation. The head, neck, chest, shoulders, arms, spine, ribs,

original: sta zur dang / brla dang / rtse dar dang / rkang pa dang / rus pa dag ces bya ba 'di ni gdags pa yin la /
analyzed: sta zur dang / brla dang / rtse dar dang / rkang pa dang / rus pa dag ces bya ba 'di ni gdags pa yin la /
translated: hips, thighs, calves, feet, and bones are all designations.

original: de yang btags pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de yang btags pa'i chos yin no //
translated: And those are designated phenomena.

original: de dag ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: Apart from being mere conventional designations by way of nominal expressions, they are neither produced nor do they cease.

original: ming de yang nang ma yin /
analyzed: ming de yang nang ma yin /
translated: And that name is not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended as other than the two.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di dag thams cad ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di dag thams cad ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, all these—the so-called perfection of wisdom, the so-called bodhisattva, and the so-called name of a bodhisattva—are mere designations of dharmas.

original: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: And that designation of dharmas is, apart from a mere designation by way of a conventional term, neither produced nor stopped.

original: ming de dag kyang nang ma yin /
analyzed: ming de dag kyang nang ma yin /
translated: Those names are not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: and not somewhere in between.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: gang 'di phyi rol gyi rtsva dang shing dang yal ga dang lo ma dad 'dab ma zhes bya ba de dag thams cad @95a * //
analyzed: gang 'di phyi rol gyi rtsva dang shing dang yal ga dang lo ma dad 'dab ma zhes bya ba de dag thams cad @95a * //
translated: All those so-called external grasses, trees, branches, leaves, and petals

original: la ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du brjod de /
analyzed: la ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du brjod de /
translated: are conventionally expressed by various names.

original: ming de dag kyang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ming de dag kyang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: Those names are not produced and do not stop, except for the mere designation by names and conventional expressions.

original: ming de dag kyang nang ma yin /
analyzed: ming de dag kyang nang ma yin /
translated: Those names are not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: are not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
translated: and are not apprehended apart from the two.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di thams cad ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di thams cad ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du brjod pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, similarly, all these—‘perfection of wisdom,’ ‘bodhisattva,’ and ‘name of a bodhisattva’—are conventionally expressed by various names.

original: ming de dag kyang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ming de dag kyang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: Those names are not produced and do not stop, except for the mere designation by names and conventional expressions.

original: ming de dag kyang nang ma yin /
analyzed: ming de dag kyang nang ma yin /
translated: Those names are not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: are not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs te /
translated: and are not apprehended apart from the two.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, should the bodhisattva great being train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, it is like this:

original: rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma dang / chu zla dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma dang / chu zla dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
translated: All those phenomena—dreams, echoes, mirages, reflections, magical displays, moons in water, and tathāgata emanations—are merely designated as phenomena.

original: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: That designation of phenomena is merely a conventional designation by way of a nominal symbol, and it is neither produced nor stopped.

original: ming de yang nang ma yin /
analyzed: ming de yang nang ma yin /
translated: That name is not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
translated: and not observed apart from the two.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa 'di dag thams cad ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes brjod pa 'di dag thams cad ni chos su btags pa tsam mo //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, all these words—‘perfection of wisdom,’ ‘bodhisattva,’ and ‘name of a bodhisattva’—are just designations for dharmas.

original: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos su btags pa de yang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: And that designation for dharmas is not produced and does not stop, except for the sake of a designation by way of a mere name and conventional term.

original: ming de dag kyang nad ma yin /
analyzed: ming de dag kyang nad ma yin /
translated: Those names are not internal,

original: phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin /
translated: not external,

original: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
translated: and not to be apprehended apart from the two.🔽“In that way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should train in the designation of a name, the designation of an instruction, and the designation of a dharma.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ming gi brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ming gi brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @95b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas ni gzugs rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @95b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas ni gzugs rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that do not see form as permanent.

original: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as impermanent.

original: gzugs bde zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs bde zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as happiness.

original: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs bdag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs bdag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as suffering.🔽They do not see form as a self.

original: gzugs bdag med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zhi zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs bdag med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zhi zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as not a self.🔽They do not see form as peaceful.

original: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as not peaceful.

original: gzugs stong zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see form as empty.

original: gzugs mi stong zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi stong zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is not empty.🔽They do not consider that form is with signs.

original: gzugs mtshan ma med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs smon pa yod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mtshan ma med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs smon pa yod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is signless.🔽They do not consider that form is with wishes.

original: gzugs smon pa med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs 'dus byas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs smon pa med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs 'dus byas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is wishless.🔽They do not consider that form is compounded.

original: gzugs 'dus ma byas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs skye zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs 'dus ma byas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs skye zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is uncompounded.🔽They do not consider that form arises.

original: gzugs mi skye zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi skye zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form does not arise.

original: gzugs 'gag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs 'gag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form ceases.

original: gzugs mi 'gag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs dben zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi 'gag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs dben zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is unceasing.🔽They do not consider that form is void.

original: gzugs mi dben zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs dge zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs mi dge zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi dben zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs dge zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs mi dge zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is not void.🔽They do not consider that form is afflicted.

original: gzugs kha na ma tho ba dang bcas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs kha na ma tho ba med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs zag pa dang bcas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kha na ma tho ba dang bcas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs kha na ma tho ba med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs zag pa dang bcas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is purified.🔽They do not consider that form is with outflows.

original: gzugs zag pa med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs nyon mongs pa dang bcas zhes @96a * //
analyzed: gzugs zag pa med ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs nyon mongs pa dang bcas zhes @96a * //
translated: They do not consider that form is without outflows.

original: bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that form is with afflictions.🔽They do not consider that form is without afflictions.

original: gzugs nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are afflicted,🔽or that they are purified.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are mundane,🔽or that they are supramundane.

original: gzugs 'jig rten pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs 'jig rten pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are the origin of suffering,🔽or that they are the cessation of suffering.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are the path,🔽or that they are not the path.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are with afflictive emotions,🔽or that they are without afflictive emotions.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are the world,🔽or that they are not the world.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are internal,🔽or that they are external.

original: gzugs 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are entities,🔽or that they are non-entities.

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are arising,🔽or that they are ceasing.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are compounded,🔽or that they are uncompounded.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are the past,🔽the future, or the present.

original: gzugs rnam par byang ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par byang ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are virtue,🔽or that they are non-virtue.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are with outflows,🔽or that they are without outflows.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are with attachment,🔽or that they are without attachment.

original: gzugs 'khor ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs 'khor ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are with anger,🔽or that they are without anger.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are with ignorance,🔽or that they are without ignorance.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are with training,🔽or that they are without training.

original: gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are with thorough affliction,🔽or that they are with complete purification.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are conditioned,🔽or that they are unconditioned.

original: tshor ba rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are the desire realm,🔽the form realm, or the formless realm.

original: mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are the perfection of generosity,🔽the perfection of patient acceptance, or the perfection of effort.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are the perfection of meditative concentration,🔽or that they are the perfection of wisdom.

original: bde zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: bde zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that physical forms are the applications of mindfulness,🔽the correct exertions, or the supports for miraculous ability.🔽They do not consider that physical forms are the faculties,🔽the powers, or the branches of

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽bdag ces bya bar ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // bdag ces bya bar ma yin /
translated: He does not see it as suffering,🔽as a self,

original: bdag med ces bya bar ma yin /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya bar ma yin /
translated: as not a self,

original: zhi zhes bya bar ma yin /
analyzed: zhi zhes bya bar ma yin /
translated: as peace,

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar ma yin /🔽tshor ba stong zhes bya bar ma yin /
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar ma yin / tshor ba stong zhes bya bar ma yin /
translated: or as not peace.🔽He does not see feeling as empty or not empty,🔽as with signs or signless,🔽as having aspirations or lacking aspirations.

original: mi stong zhes bya bar ma yin /🔽mtshan ma yod ces bya bar ma yin /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar ma yin / mtshan ma yod ces bya bar ma yin /
translated: He does not see it as compounded or uncompounded,🔽as arising or ceasing,🔽as being tainted or untainted,🔽as calm or not calm,

original: mtshan ma med ces bya bar ma yin /🔽smon pa yod ces bya bar ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma med ces bya bar ma yin / smon pa yod ces bya bar ma yin /
